attributes.action: Prevent Billionaires from the use of Covid-19 monetary schemes before an audit
attributes.additional_details:
I want to protect the English treasury from abuse from international companies especially though who pay very little tax and contribute very little to the upkeep of the country.
International companies that for lough staff that fail an audit test should be charge 100% of the cost of forloughing staff
attributes.background: We need to prevent the abuse of the Covid-19 monetary scheme by those who is was not designed for. Any international company with revenue in the multi-millions/billions should have an audit to see if they should have access to the monetary scheme.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to restrict who Covid-19 support is made avaialble to, but it's not clear how you want this to happen, and under what conditions businesses would or would not be entitled to support.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Stop Multi Million pound companies claiming government funded furlough payments: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314882

Ban or limit bailouts for big businesses: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303614

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
